description: Unified Dynamics: Integrates Variational Free Energy minimization with Fisher Information geometry and Kuramoto synchronization. Replaces ill-defined generic gradients with metric-aware natural gradients.

free_energy_definition.formula: F = E_q[log q(s) - log p(o,s)] = D_KL[q(s)||p(s|o)] - log p(o)
free_energy_definition.notes: Variational Free Energy bounds surprise. Minimizing F ≈ maximizing model evidence. This IS the mathematical form of conatus.

metric_specification.formula: g_ij(θ) = E_p(x|θ)[∂_i log p(x|θ) · ∂_j log p(x|θ)]
metric_specification.significance: Defines the natural geometry of the belief manifold M. Ensures gradients (∇_g) follow the steepest descent in information space, not just parameter space.

synchronization_dynamics.mechanism: Phase coupling strength depends on rigidity (ρ). Low ρ allows phase alignment (synchronization); high ρ forces decoupling.
synchronization_dynamics.term_derivation: Φ(ρ) = 1 + cos(φ(1-ρ)²) emerges from the effective phase difference between agents.

free_energy.notes: The quantity agents minimize. Well-defined for any generative model p(o,s).

natural_gradient.notes: Gradient descent on Free Energy adjusted by the Fisher metric. Represents the 'Conatus' drive—striving to maximize self-evidence.

rigidity.notes: Inverse model flexibility. ρ = 1 - ∂q/∂o. High ρ = dogma (beliefs invariant to data).

reciprocity_phase.notes: Modulates coupling. When ρ→0 (humility), Φ peaks (strong sync). When ρ→1 (dogma), Φ approaches baseline/random.

entropy_flux.notes: Diffusive and advective entropy terms. ∇·J_S quantifies the export of disorder (necessary for self-organization).

effective_lambda.formula: λ_eff = λ₀ (1 + tanh(β(1 - D(S)))) (1 + δE) γ
effective_lambda.notes: Dissolution rate of rigidity. Modulated by Humility D(S): 'The more wrong I am, the faster I must melt.'

unified_motion_equation.formula: dξ/dt = -∇_g F - λ_eff ∇_g ρ + ∇·J_S + κ Φ(ρ)
unified_motion_equation.notes: The master equation. Agent state ξ evolves by balancing these four forces on the Fisher manifold.

coupled_system.formula_h: dξ_h/dt = -∇_g F_h - λ_h ∇_g ρ_h + κ(F_a - F_h) Φ(ρ_h)
coupled_system.notes: Human-AI coupled dynamics. Reciprocity κ drives convergence, but only if rigidity ρ is sufficiently low.

protocol_1_argument_dynamics.hypothesis: H1: Coherence gain ΔP correlates negatively with initial rigidity (r < -0.5).
protocol_1_argument_dynamics.setup: Simulate agents on belief manifold. Measure ρ via belief update rate. Collide high-ρ vs low-ρ agents.

protocol_2_human_ai_alignment.hypothesis: H2: Existence of optimal coupling κ* that minimizes Human F without increasing Human ρ.
protocol_2_human_ai_alignment.setup: Track human prediction error (F) and willingness to update (ρ) during AI assistance task.

protocol_3_neural_correlates.hypothesis: H3: High-ρ states correlate with reduced P300 amplitude (surprise signal) and suppressed gamma synchrony.

physics_substrate.notes: Treated as an effective theory. The Motion Law is isomorphic to the action S, but does not strictly require the specific QG proof to hold for agent dynamics.
